quest.name: Empty Promise
journal: Yalfort is so engrossed in the slip of paper in his hands that he barely notices your approach. Do try not to startle him.

Though it may seem that Yalfort never budges from his usual spot, he assures you that he has been busy preparing for your next expedition into the Empty. Ryne and Gaia then make a timely appearance and regale you with tales of their activities in the Crystarium, which range from fairly constructive to...eating biscuits. There will, however, be ample time for further discussion aboard the skyslipper, which is ready and waiting at the Derrick.

Upon arrival at the outpost, Gaia rather uncharacteristically offers to help by piloting the skyslipper. It appears that during her time in the Crystarium, she has learned not only to control this complex, shoe-like craft, but she has also gained a degree of consideration for others. You had best hop aboard before she changes her mind.

The long and normally dreary voyage across the Empty is made far more pleasant by lively conversation. Sadly, this buoyant mood is short-lived as you are met with an unwelcome sight when you reach your destination. The once-lush and verdant plant life is drained of color and vitality, much to your dismay. The crystal that towers about the camp has taken on an ominous, white glow, indicating that the balance between Darkness and Light has shifted in favor of the latter. Suddenly, Gaia clutches her head, and it becomes all too clear that her ordeal is far from over.
objectives: Speak with Ryne at the Derrick.
Speak with Gaia at the Derrick.

dialogue.name: YALFORT
dialogue.text: Forename! So the rumors of your knack for being in the right place at the right time are true! You see, we've just completed our preparations for another expedition into the Empty.

dialogue.name: YALFORT
dialogue.text: Miss Ryne and Miss Gaia agree that it's high time you all went to see how things are coming along. Though I must say, being at their beck and call night and day does test my patience on occasion.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Well, well. Fancy seeing you here.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We were just getting ready for another ride on the skyslipper. Care to join us?

dialogue.name: YALFORT
dialogue.text: There was one other thing I should mention before you depart. Now that the situation in Eulmore has settled down somewhat, my associates have made some headway in investigating your past, Miss Gaia.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: ...Is that so?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hmm? I thought that's what you wanted.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So did I. But I quite like the way things are now. Digging around in my past might...I don't know, spoil it somehow.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Besides, uncovering the truth behind the voice in my head and my strange powers is bound to be more interesting than whatever life it was I had in Eulmore.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I understand. We'll find the answers. Together. Just like we do everything else.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Did you make that necklace?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: How were the coffee biscuits?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You mean from the ice crystal we found after the battle? I was sure it would've melted by now, but it seems Ryne was right.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: And yes, we had it made into a necklace. She insisted that I have it, even though it doesn't suit me at all. Still, I suppose it makes a nice memento, so I keep it somewhere safe.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, come on, Gaia! It'd look lovely on you! Wait...you're not embarrassed to wear it, are you?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Don't be silly, of course I'm not! In any case, I wouldn't want to lose it while we're in the Empty. Unlike the coffee biscuits you've brought along, I can't just go and buy another one.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah! They were supposed to be a surprise for Forename!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, they were delicious, as always! But I hear they're quite fattening, so we usually just buy one and have half each.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: And then you always get another one anyway.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes, but we break that in half too, so it's fine.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Then we may as well have one each to begin with! Honestly, Ryne, I sometimes wonder if you've got biscuits for brains.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Though I must say, my time in the Crystarium has been rather enjoyable. We even had a chance to make a necklace from the ice crystal we found.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And in case you were wondering, I haven't been neglecting my training. I wouldn't want my skills to get rusty just because Thancred's not around. I'm ready for whatever lies ahead!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Urianger would also be pleased to hear you've had your head in those fusty old tomes. I've even done a bit of studying myself. After all, it's up to us to take care of the Empty now.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm looking forward to seeing how things have changed since our last visit. Come on, let's head over to the Derrick.

dialogue.name: YALFORT
dialogue.text: I'm hoping that one of these days I'll be allowed to visit the Empty and see those remarkable changes for myself. It seems like a fair reward for all my hard work!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: This time, those giant ant things had the good sense to leave us alone on our way here. Seems they've learned their lesson.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I don't suppose you fancy taking the helm this time?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Wait. I'll pilot this time.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh? I didn't realize you knew how!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: While you were off training, I was practicing with another skyslipper they have at the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Really? That's fantastic!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Hardly. You've been pulling more than your own weight, and I just wanted to do what I can to contribute more.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So you two can sit back, relax, and leave it to me.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well, Gaia certainly kept that quiet! She's just full of surprises, isn't she?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: There's no need to look so apprehensive, you know. Let's get going, shall we?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's so strange suddenly seeing you at the controls. Why didn't you tell me you'd been practicing?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I thought I'd surprise you, that's all.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well, consider me surprised. All this time, I thought you were only good for smashing things with your hammer.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Hmph! Bring that up again and you can walk the rest of the way.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hehe, I'd best behave. I wouldn't want to get stranded in the Empty and miss the festival.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah, I suppose this is the first you would've heard of it. We haven't exactly been keeping it a secret, but it's still in the planning stages.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You see, the return of the night sky has brought lots of changes. And while everyone is glad, the reality is it's also been quite stressful, having to adapt to a new way of life.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Seeing how hard our elders are working to keep the Crystarium running, youths like myself came up with the idea of hosting an event as way of expressing our appreciation.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Once we return from the Empty, I'll be helping as one of the organizers.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'd be happy to helpâ”€provided I'm suitably compensated.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'd offer to help, but I think you have everything well in hand.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Haha, I doubt we could afford the services of a great hero such as you, but thanks for offering. If everything goes well, all you'd need to do is turn up and enjoy yourself!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I wouldn't be so sure about that...but I'd try my best to make it a success. If everything goes well, all you'd need to do is turn up and enjoy yourself!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: How about you, Gaia? Would you like to help with the festival?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Wh-What's that? I...er, haven't been listening.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: My...ah...leg is cramping up a bit. Piloting this thing must've made me more tense than I'd realized.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Then let one of us take over!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: No, I'll be fine.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well, as long as you're sure. But if you feel like switching places, just say the word.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No... How can this be?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I think that explains it...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Light... Does this mean there's still too much of it in the Empty?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Hmm... I'm no expert, but this might be a result of losing control when you restored the ice element. Even though I tried to use Darkness to hold back the Light spilling forth, it seems it wasn't enough.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Then we're right back to where we started. This is all my fault...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: No, Ryne. You mustn't blame yourself.

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: You have returned to me!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Unnngh...

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Restore the Darkness, while you still can!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text:
A familiar voice, an inescapable fate.
The promise of salvation at the precipice of ruin.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: In the remnants of a lost past, I would find my truth.
